;菲律宾总统小费迪南德·马科斯希望通过公民对新口号的热情不高，他们认为该国需要改善基础设施来吸引游客，而不是“乏味”的口号。

;

;马科斯说，最新的品牌活动“爱菲律宾”，将成为旅游业从新冠疫情低迷中缓慢复苏的“路标”。

;

;“它源于你、我和我们所有人对菲律宾的真诚热爱，”他在一次活动中说道，以取代已有十年之久的“菲律宾更有趣”的口号。

;

;马科斯补充说，该举措旨在将菲律宾转变为区域“旅游强国”，提供比据《马尼拉公报》报道，他还呼吁菲律宾人“继续向世界介绍菲律宾作为顶级旅游中心”，并成为东南亚国家的旅游大使.

;

;“我恳请你们所有人成为我们国家的推动者、倡导者，如果我可以借用一个在这个社交媒体时代创造的术语的话，那就是成为我们国家的顶级影响者，”马科斯说。

;

;去年六月上任的总统在他的第一份国情咨文中指出，重振旅游业是他的首要任务之一。

;

;旅游部的数据显示该国欢迎今年前5个月外国游客超过200万人次。到 2022 年，该行业还将为马尼拉的 GDP 贡献 6.2%。

;

;根据标准普尔全球市场情报 (S&P Global Market Intelligence) 的数据，亚太地区国际旅游业的反弹预计到明年将达到大流行前的高位。

;

;旅游部长克里斯蒂娜·弗拉斯科 (Christina Frasco) 表示，“热爱菲律宾”是“对该国自然资产、丰富历史和文化多样性的认可”。

;

;但菲律宾社交媒体用户将营销活动视为“单调且懒惰”，说它缺乏创造力，听起来像是一个“命令”，而不是访问这个国家的邀请。

;

;有人建议在爱情后面加一个逗号会让它看起来更好，而另一些人则抱怨反对将公共资金花在标语上、忽视旅游和机场设施、未能缓解交通拥堵、惩戒傲慢的移民官员以及控制出租车乱收费。

;

;“顺便说一句，为了吸引更多游客，最好一位推特用户写道：“建设更便捷的基础设施，让菲律宾成为更安全、更舒适的旅游目的地。”

;

;近几个月来，马尼拉机场因空中交通管制故障和频繁停电而困扰，数百架航班受到影响。并导致数千名乘客滞留。

;

;旅游局局长弗拉斯科承认该国的机场需要升级以吸引游客，并补充说她的部门正在与交通部合作改善设施。

;

;网民还批评新政府改变口号，指出邻国马来西亚（马来西亚，真正的亚洲）和泰国（神奇的泰国）多年来一直保留其口号。

;

;“它们都描绘了经历。他们让观众一睹这个国家的魅力。”一位用户说道。

;

;一些人呼吁恢复旧口号。

;

;“爱情是复杂的。乐趣不是。带回菲律宾更有趣。”

;原共青团中央书记处书记秦一智被任命为中国国家民委第四号代表，这是他在陷入停滞的政治生涯中连续第三次担任代表。

;

;一位观察人士表示，秦的一系列代表职务表明了共产党领导层的深层次忧虑青年组织干部在关键部委或党的机关担任高层职务的能力——这一担忧促使习近平主席在 2015 年下令对共青团进行重大改革。

;

;秦，57 岁，周二，在新疆维吾尔自治区伊犁市志愿者项目启动仪式上，他首次以国家民委“专职委员”的身份公开露面。

;

; NEAC官方网站周二将秦列为领导层，排在该委员会主任潘岳和两名副手之后。

;

;是什么让中国曾经强大的共青团边缘化？

;

;秦被任命在敏感的西藏自治区工作十多年后，于 2013 年 3 月担任青组织第一书记，其职业道路与前副总理胡春华（共青团系统的政治重量级人物）类似。

;<胡锦涛在十月份的党的二十大代表大会上辞去了政治局委员职务，尽管他距离同级别的退休年龄还差九岁。他于三月辞去副总理职务。

;

;这被视为新的证据，表明党的青年机构——前国家主席胡锦涛和前总理李克强的权力基础，曾被认为是晋升的快车道– 已经失去了习近平的青睐。

;

;习近平在2015年首次批评共青团，称其“脱离了地面”并且“从头到下截瘫了”。

;

;习近平在2015年首次批评共青团。 p>;

;一年后，党的最高纪检组猛烈抨击了这个青年组织，称其深受“精英主义”困扰，并下令对联赛进行全面改革。

;

;2017年9月，秦任国家质检总局副局长。六个月后，他再次调任国家市场监督管理总局副局长，直至最近一次调任。

;

;在周一与新共青团领导成员的会议上当选为中央委员会委员后，习近平呼吁“坚定勇气”推进组织改革。他命令领导团队继续提高“引导、组织和服务”国家青年的能力。

;

;据国立中央大学李光耀公共政策学院副教授 Alfred Wu 表示新加坡大学的秦在多个党和国家职能中担任副职，这表明北京认为他还没有准备好独自承担一线角色。

;

;“这一次，他甚至没有获得副职头衔。这说明了很多，”吴说，并补充说，尽管进行了横向调动，北京仍然希望利用秦在西藏期间获得的在少数民族问题上的经验。

;

;“[共产主义青年团]不是不再是党内的一个派系。现在，它只是一个在党的政治指导下服务的青年机构，不再给干部带来光环。”

;

;吴指出，共青团的新任书记阿东已经 52 岁了，比他的前任老得多，他们在四十多岁甚至三十多岁时就晋升到了该职位。

;香港政府五年来已批准 361 名申请人在香港工作推出三项人才入境计划，涵盖专业范围更广。

;

;劳工及福利局周三公布的统计数据显示，2018年至2023年5月，共有364名优秀人才入境计划（QMAS）申请、一般就业政策（GEP）及输入内地人才计划（ASMTP），录取率达99%。

;

;劳工处提供数字回应立法会议员陈培良的提问当局上个月将涵盖的职业数量从 13 个扩大到 51 个后，关于这些计划的批准情况。

;

;为什么中国大陆的专业人士主导了香港的人才搜寻？

;

;香港已经共有七项人才计划，最新一项是行政长官李家超去年12月推出的。该计划被称为“顶尖人才通行证计划”，旨在填补至少 14 万名离开香港劳动力的缺口。

;

;所有计划都简化了工作签证流程，使公司能够雇用外国人和中国大陆人

;

;在该部门周三提出的三项计划中，ASMTP申请人（即来自大陆的申请人）占了报名人数的90%。另外两个计划的外国申请人包括来自美国的申请人，其中有 10 名候选人；澳大利亚，有四个；加拿大，其中 3 名和 19 名被列为“其他”。

;

;在 QMAS 批准的 256 名申请人中，近一半（即 121 人）拥有硕士学位或至少两个学士学位，而 29% 的人拥有硕士学位一个博士学位或至少两个硕士学位。超过 55% 的申请者还拥有至少五年的研究生或专家级工作经验。

;

;尽管向 51 个不同的职业开放，但这三个计划的申请仅涵盖 14 个行业，即最受欢迎的行业商会调查发现，四分之三的香港公司面临人才短缺的问题;

;金融科技，涉及使用计算机程序和其他技术支持银行和金融服务的专业是第二受欢迎的职业，资产管理的批准数量最多，为 145 人，占总数 361 人的 40%。

;

;另外 65 人，即 18 人占总数的 % 是创新和技术专家。

;

;获准参加工作的新专业人士中，近三分之二（即 235 名）年龄在 18 岁至 39 岁之间。

;

;有一门艺术自5月16日该职业被添加到名单以来，申请工作签证并获得批准的发起人。

;

;这三个计划中，大约四分之三的批准申请人是男性。

;美国立法者呼吁华盛顿不要更新已有四年历史的科学和技术与中国的技术合作协议，他们声称该协议可能开发了威胁美国利益的知识，包括气球和农业技术。

;

;分析人士称，如果该协议终止，将证明华盛顿试图与北京脱钩预计科学研究环境将更加分散，而不是全球化。

;

;在周二提交给美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯的一封信中，包括特别委员会主席在内的 10 名国会议员表示：中国问题委员会迈克·加拉格尔 (Mike Gallagher) 敦促政府不要在协议于 8 月 27 日到期后延长该协议。

;

;加拉格尔的 24 人专门委员会于 1 月成立，重点关注与北京的经济和安全竞争。

;

;该协议全称“美国和中华人民共和国科学技术合作协议”(STA)，于 1979 年由时任美国总统吉米·卡特签署，旨在“加强友好关系”除其他目标外，“两国关系”。

;

;“我们对[中华人民共和国]此前利用 STA 来推进其军事目标感到担忧，并将继续这样做，”信中指出，并补充说，有报道表明，根据该计划组织的研究伙伴关系“可能开发出后来用于对抗美国的技术”。

;

;立法者指责北京使用“气球技术” - 类似于由美国国家海洋和大气管理局和中国气象局在 STA 项目下联合开发的一项技术——“监视美国领土上的美国军事基地”。

;

;中美关系是否会解冻还是只是一个管控分歧的时代？

;

;在中国国家主席习近平呼吁农业技术方面，美国和中国有“十几个活跃的研究项目”，这也是国会议员关注的一个领域在三月份的中国年度全国人大会议“两会”上，最高领导人强调要确保粮食和其他重要农产品的稳定安全供应，目标是到本世纪中叶将国家建成农业强国。

;

;中国智库盘古智库政治分析人士许钦铎表示，国家税务总局的作用是促进农业合作华盛顿对中国日益增长的技术实力感到担忧，无论它是否继续具有象征意义，这些国家都受到了限制。

;

;“美国同意续签协议可能会带来一些乐观情绪，因为华盛顿确实相信科学技术的发展。”交流是稳定关系所必需的； “相反，世界上最关键国家之间的关系预计会变得更糟。”徐说，并补充说，没有一个国家会从支离破碎的科学世界中受益。

;

;议员们还指责北京利用学术研究人员、工业间谍活动、强制技术转让以及其他策略来获得关键技术的优势，这反过来又推动了人民解放军的现代化”。

;

;“中华人民共和国将利用民用资源也就不足为奇了。最大程度地建立军事目的研究伙伴关系。中华人民共和国公开承认其军民融合的做法，”信中继续说道。 “美国必须停止助长自己的毁灭。让 STA 到期是良好的第一步。”

;

;两名女孩因误食疑似糖果而在香港住院几天后恢复知觉含有来自她们父亲表弟的违禁大麻二酚 (CBD)。

;姐妹俩的母亲 Selena Miu 周三在 Facebook 帖子中表示，这对分别为两岁和四岁的姐妹仍在重症监护室，并补充说，尽管他们现在可以吃饭、交谈并认出她，但他们还是很累，反应很慢。

;据《华盛顿邮报》报道，据称，他们父亲 48 岁的表妹不小心给他们喂了糖果已经学会了。她早些时候因涉嫌忽视儿童而被捕。

;

;这位 25 岁的父亲因涉嫌忽视儿童和持有毒品而被指控。

;

;虐待或忽视儿童根据《侵害人身罪条例》，儿童可被判处最高 10 年监禁。

;

;CBD 是在大麻植物或其近亲大麻中发现的 100 多种化合物之一。也有可能从其他非大麻植物中提取。

;

;“除了 CBD 产品在香港是非法的之外……如果年仅两岁和两岁的儿童周三早上，香港大学儿科及青少年医学系的Patrick Ip Pak-keung博士在广播节目中表示：“吃了四颗适合成人的CBD糖果，严重超标。”

;

;< p>;“理论上，如果提取得当，CBD可以用于医疗目的。例如，纯 CBD 对患有癫痫症的儿童非常有帮助，”他说。 “不幸的是，在大麻相关产品的提取过程中，很难避免 THC 污染。如果 THC 混入 CBD 产品，例如 CBD 糖果，使用者可能会中毒。”

; Wed, 28 Jun 2023 13:50:02 +0800 6 out of 7 Hong Kong universities in global survey drop down the rankings; HKUST plummets 20 places to 60th spothttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/education/article/3225687/6-out-7-hong-kong-universities-global-survey-drop-down-rankings-hkust-plummets-20-places-60th-spot?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.28 13:10;

;Six of seven publicly funded Hong Kong universities included in a global rating survey have dropped down the table, with international research and student employability after graduation among the reasons cited for the falls.

;

;Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) dropped 20 places to 60th, it was announced on Wednesday, the institution's worst performance since the Quacquarelli Symonds World University Rankings was launched 12 years ago.

;

;It was also the first time the Sai Kung-based university has dropped out of the top 50.

;

;The University of Hong Kong (HKU) fell five spots from last year to 26th in the world and Chinese University slid nine places to 47th.

;

;Only Polytechnic University held on to its 65th position from last year. It was also the first time the institution has outstripped City University, which dropped from 54th to 70th.

;

;Baptist University slid from 281st place to 295th and Lingnan University dropped out of the 601st to 650th range to 641st to 650th, its worst ranking in more than a decade.

;

;Scores for the international research network metric for the seven universities dropped by 24 to 95 per cent compared with last year.

;

;The indicator measures the ability of institutions to diversify their research networks through collaboration with overseas universities.

;

;QS said while Hong Kong had been recognised for its world-class research published in high-impact journals, the city performed relatively poorly when it came to international collaboration.

;

;4 universities in Hong Kong rise in ranking of Asia's top schools

;

;“In international research network, no Hong Kong universities are among the world's top 300,” it said, adding even HKU, the city's top university, only placed 355th.

;

;“Currently, around 20 per cent of the world's research is done as a result of international collaboration. While Hong Kong conducts a massive 74 per cent of its research alongside international partners, just under three quarters of this is with China, highlighting the importance of a diverse and globalised research agenda,” it added.

;

;The Britain-based education information firm also said Hong Kong should take comfort in the fact that the global academic community now regarded its higher education sector highly once again, following a dip in the reputation of the city's tertiary institutions earlier due to “sociopolitical friction”.

;

;All the universities saw a drop in the “employer reputation” metric compared with last year, with the decline ranging from 1 to almost 40 per cent according to the survey results gathered from thousands of employers around the world.

;

;“Hong Kong appears to struggle in translating its academic excellence to the job market. For employer reputation, the top performer is HKU which places 159th,” it said.

;

;HKUST's spokeswoman said rankings went up and down because of a variety of factors.

;

;“HKUST will take them as useful references to learn more about our and other universities' performance and identify areas for improvement,” she added.

;

;A Chinese University spokeswoman said the global higher education sector was still recovering from the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic, which had affected a range of factors, including the mobility of students from outside the city and international recruitment of academics.

;

;Hong Kong universities' drop in global rankings blamed on lack of collaboration

;

;But she added: “Chinese University is now experiencing a strong recovery in non-local student demand and is ramping up its efforts to recruit talented scholars from around the world.”

;

;A HKU spokesman said the university remained steadfast in its commitment to delivering exceptional education for its students, with a relentless pursuit of excellence in teaching, research and knowledge exchange.

;

;The Education University of Hong Kong was not included in the survey.

;

;The 2024 results were announced by Quacquarelli Symonds which rated 1,500 tertiary institutions around the world.

;

;Education University of Hong Kong head predicts more cuts to teacher training spots

;

;The ratings were partly based on the analysis of about 17.5 million academic papers and the opinions of more than 240,000 academics and employers.

;

;A total of nine areas were assessed, including academic reputation, reputation among employers, academic staff to student ratio, citations per faculty, international faculty ratio, international student ratio, sustainability, employment figures and international research network.

;

;The last three indicators were new this year and each represents five per cent of the weighting. They served only as references last year.

;

;Alexa Chow Yee-ping, the managing director of recruitment agency ACTS Consulting, said university education had been hit in recent years by the 2019 social unrest and the Covid-19 pandemic, where classes may have been skipped and instruction was switched to online.

;

;“Some employers even asked me whether the graduates ever seriously studied before graduation as they felt the new graduates fared badly when compared to graduates in previous years,” she said.

;

;Massachusetts Institute of Technology remained the top-ranked university for the 12th year in a row, followed by Cambridge University, which held on to its second place position from last year.

;

;Oxford University and Harvard University each inched up a spot to third and fourth respectively. Stanford University dropped from third place to fifth.

;

;The National University of Singapore was the top institution in Asia and went up from 11th to eighth position.

;

;In mainland China, Peking University dropped five spots to 17th and Tsinghua University slid from 14th to 25th.

; Wed, 28 Jun 2023 13:20:02 +0800 Belarus leader Lukashenko says he told Wagner chief to stop Russian mutiny or be ‘crushed like a bug’https://www.scmp.com/news/world/russia-central-asia/article/3225678/belarus-leader-lukashenko-says-he-told-wagner-chief-stop-russian-mutiny-or-be-crushed-bug?utm_source=rss_feed

;Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko said he personally intervened with Vladimir Putin and the founder of the Wagner mercenary group to prevent bloodshed during the weekend mutiny in Russia.

;

;In Lukashenko's version of the events, published by the state-owned news agency Belta on Tuesday, he persuaded the Russian president to let him reach out to Wagner's Yevgeny Prigozhin as his mercenaries marched unimpeded to almost 200km (124 miles) from Moscow.

;

;Lukashenko said he urged Putin not to kill Prigozhin and warned the Wagner chief halfway on the march to Moscow that “you'll just be crushed like a bug”.

;

;In the deal brokered by his Belarusian counterpart, Putin pledged to close criminal proceedings targeting Prigozhin and let his troops join the Russian army, return to their families or go to Belarus, in return for their ending the revolt.

;

;Prigozhin was agitated on the call and demanded justice from leaders in Moscow, Lukashenko said. “We spoke in profanities for the first round of 30 minutes.”

;

;In numerous vulgarity-laden video and audio recordings as the war on Ukraine dragged into its 17th month, Prigozhin accused Putin's military officials of incompetence and of trying to destroy his private army by bringing it under their command.

;

;Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny thought Wagner revolt was a 'joke'

;

;Lukashenko said he had offered assistance to Wagner mercenaries who came to Belarus, and an abandoned base to stay at, but said they'd have to pay their way.

;

;He also raised the prospect of their becoming a unit within the Belarusian military, but said he wouldn't have Wagner guard the nuclear arms that Russia is delivering to Belarus.

;

;Belarus also won't allow any Wagner recruitment offices, Lukashenko said, warning that anyone who joins the private military company should be ready to go to bed each night “hugging death”.

;

;Putin, in his first address to Russia since the mutiny was called off, thanked Lukashenko on Monday night for “his efforts and contribution in peacefully resolving the situation”.

;

;High-profile Russian state TV presenter Vladimir Solovyov said Lukashenko deserved to be made a Hero of Russia and Dmitry Peskov, Putin's spokesman, on Tuesday lavished praise on the Belarusian leader.

;

;Lukashenko was “a very experienced and wise statesman” with whom Putin had long enjoyed good working and friendly relations, said Peskov.

;

;International sanctions against Lukashenko's regime for a brutal crackdown on protesters after he claimed re-election in 2020 have left him increasingly dependent on Putin economically and politically.

;

;The long-time leader allowed Russia to use his country as a staging ground for the invasion of Ukraine last year.

;

;Exiled opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya said she is going to Brussels on Tuesday to participate in discussions with European leaders on preventing Belarus from turning into a Russian colony.

;

;“We Belarusians need neither Prigozhin's thugs, nor Russian nuclear missiles, nor a strong hand,” Tsikhanouskaya said on Telegram.

;

;

;The other three are Duke University and the University of Colorado in the United States, and the University of Western Australia.

;The list also includes more medical qualifications from universities added in the previous three rounds, such as four-year programmes at Cambridge and Oxford universities.

;

;The scheme, introduced under the amended Medical Registration Ordinance in 2021, aims to address a dire labour shortage in the public healthcare sector, which is expected to worsen in the coming years.

;

;Three batches of recognised programmes from 74 medical schools have been announced since April 2022.

;

;The scheme allows non-locally trained doctors with recognised medical qualifications from a specified list to obtain full registration in the city without taking the licensing exam.

;

;Only 65 overseas doctors apply for special scheme to work in Hong Kong

;

;But certain requirements must be met. These include holding medical registration in their place of graduation, having worked full-time in Hong Kong's public sector for at least five years after obtaining a specialist qualification, and being deemed to have served “satisfactorily and competently” during the five-year period.

;

;Fresh graduates from the recognised medical programmes who are Hong Kong permanent residents but have yet to complete an internship in the countries where they trained will also be eligible to take the licensing exam and undergo an internship in the city.

;

;Previously, non-locally trained doctors were required to take the licensing exam even when they had already completed an internship elsewhere.
